intro: Psychotria stricta var. ou-hinnae, commonly known as the "Bali Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Bali. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers with five petals, which are often followed by bright red berries. It thrives in tropical rainforest environments and is often found in shaded, moist areas of the forest understory. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
